intro: Onoseris purpurata, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy purple petals surrounding a central disk of yellow florets, and its leaves are typically lance-shaped with rough textures. Onoseris purpurata thrives in moist to wet environments, often found in swamps and along stream banks. It plays an important role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
